Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: I saw something on another board but, since I am not here often, I am not sure it is about her. Hoping I'm wrong. Lotusblossom Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Has anyone heard from Anko66? lotusblossom teacher911

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Hi all, I have been on Navelbine for the past two and a half years. Throughout this time, I have managed to keep side effects to a minimum. I exercise regularly and lead a busy but enjoyable life. During my last chemo cycle, I experienced severe joint and muscle pain. The pain came on very suddenly, lasted a couple of days, and then disappeared suddenly. I also have developed tinitis, which I have had non-stop since the first pain episode. My MO ran a full set of blood tests and it turns out that my CRP is, to use his words, through the roof. He quickly referred my to a rheumatoid arthritis specialist. They both agreed that the chemo is causing me to experience severe rheumatoid arthritis, although it is odd that I am experiencing this after being on this chemo for so long. Has anyone else had this type of SE? If so, please share your experience. Thanks! Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Chemo-induced rheumatoid arthritis? lotusblossom ibcmets

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Hi all. After 3.5 years of varios chemos, it seems my lung mets are too stubborn to go away.  They have remained stable for over a year now.  The are described as tiny mm nodes and ground glass in the upper right lobe and lower left lobe.  I am wondering if I could be a candidate for radiation therapy and will ask my onc when I see him in 6 weeks.  Do any of you have any comments or experience with this?  Thanks! Lotusblossom Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Radiation for Lung mets anyone? lotusblossom Fitztwins

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Oprah Winfrey brought her show to Montreal on Thursday.  She donated 200 tickets to the Canadian Cancer Society and they offered 2 to me, since I do volunteer work for them.  I decided to go with my 21 year old son. I have always been a little on-the-fence about Oprah, not really knowing what to think when I find her a little too "preachy".  Well, I am no longer on the fence about this woman.  I LOVE her! She talked a bit about having cancer.  Basically, she said:  You have cancer, you are in chemotherapy.  But cancer does NOT define you.  It is NOT who you are.  You are here.  You are a positive energy with so much to give to the universe.  Use your positive energy.  Give to the universe.  What you give, you will get back. Enjoy the moment. Live. My son sat there with his arms around me, crying.  I had tears pouring down my face.  It was like she knew me.  Like she had looked into my heart and seen what was there.  She managed to put into words the way I, and many of us on this board, have been trying to live since this terrible diagnosis. After hearing Oprah speak, I will never be the same. Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: How Oprah Touched Me lotusblossom bhd1

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Hi all, The local Policeman's Brotherhood will be launching its' annual Shave to Fight Cancer campaign next week . I have been asked to speak about the effects of being bald ( how others treat you, feelings, etc.). Do any of you have any thoughts or experiences you would like to share with me on this? Thanks for the help. Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Please share your experience after losing your hair lotusblossom marywh

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Ladies, I have been either stable or regression with Navelbine for the past 22 months.  My MOhas offer me a 2 month break for the summer.  I am really nervous about this since I have never taken a break in the 4 years since I started this.  Also, I have heard horror stories of people who took a break and the cancer went out of control during the break. So I am really nervous... On the other hand, I now have a very fatty liver from all the chemo and my spleen is starting to swell, so I know my body is sending me signs that I should take a break. Can you please share your eperience with me?  How long was your break?  Did you have progression/regression/stability during it?  How long into your break did you start to feel normal (whatever that is!!!!)? And any other info/opinion you might have. Thanks! Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: For those of you who have taken chemo breaks lotusblossom hydeskate

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: Our family just came back from a week long retreat with this organization.  Out of the five families there, three had a stage IV diagnosis.  It was absolutely wonderful for my family to meet other families going through the same things as us. It made us realize that we are not alone. Little Pink Houses of Hope is the real deal. These people are loving and generous. No judgements are made and everyone is embraced. We cannot believe that we were fortunate enough to have had such a fun-filled and exciting beach vacation as this one. I encourage those of you who are interested in offering your family the opportunity to create great memories to apply. www.littlepink.org Lotusblossom Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Little Pink Houses of Hope lotusblossom

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: After 21 months on Navelbine, where I had regression at the beginning, but then moved to stable for 6 months, I cannot believe that my scan today showed regression again!! I am thrilled about this news.  My MO had given Navelbine a 5% chance of working, since it was my fifth line of chemo.  But now, with these results, we don't know what to think!!! I hope to be a Navy bean for a long, long time! Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
Posts.Title: Thought it had stopped working but... lotusblossom tortoise

Posts.Content: lotusblossom wrote: In June, 2009 I was told that I had metastatic cancer of unknown origin.  I had so many mets that they could not find the primary ( lungs, spleen, biliary tract, bones, pericardial sac, chest wall, lymph nodes, uterus.....).  So, I was given a cocktail of Xeloda and Gemzar to see what it did to me. After a few months, it was decided that I had Triple Negative breast cancer. Since then, I have gone through the original Xeloda/Gemzar, Doxil, Taxol and Navelbine. The Navelbine seemed to work the best of all of the regimens, reducing the mets significantly.  Howver, I began to have an auto-immune reaction to the Navelbine, much similar to rheumatoid arthritis.  In March, the reaction was so severe that I could not get out of bed for 3 days and lost most of my hair.  My onc decided to give me a chemo break, saying he did not want the chemo to kill me.  He also said that he had never seen a reaction like mine to the Navelbine and suspected that the auto-immune reaction might be attacking the cancer.  So yesterday a PET scan was done:NED! I am stunned. I still cannot believe it!  I went from being told 5 years ago to put my affairs in order to yesterday being told it is all gone. It's like waking up from a nightmare. I cried more yesterday than I have cried in the past 5 years, like a dam just burst and everything came flowing out... I am not sure how long NED will last or what the next steps are since my onc gave me the news over the phone. He was also so emotional that all he could say was, "Good news, it's gone. Have a nice weekend" as his voice choked up. So this morning I woke up to a rainy day, but I don't care. In my heart, it's a great day! Never give up! Lotusblossom Dx 6/5/2009, Right, <1cm, Stage IV, metastasized to bone/lungs/other, mets, ER-/PR-, HER2- Log in to post a reply
